title: User sees Media Gateway initSession call
Route MLB audio using features array
Route LEGACY audio using features array
Unique ID Assignment
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is watching an MLB.tv streaming session
custom_steps: WHEN the streaming session starts
custom_expected:
THEN a unique ID (video.fguid) should be assigned to the streaming session
AND the unique ID should be passed to Adobe Analytics (evar80)

title: Video Content Type Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is interacting with MLB.tv content
custom_steps: WHEN the content type is Live, Archive, VOD, SVOD, SLIVE, ADHOC, or MLBN
custom_expected: THEN the content type should be tracked in Adobe Analytics (evar184, evar100)

title: Video Content Identification
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is watching MLB.tv content
custom_steps: WHEN the content has a unique identifier (video.contentId)
custom_expected: THEN the content ID should be tracked in Adobe Analytics (eVar186)

title: Media Identification within a Game
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is watching MLB.tv content
custom_steps: WHEN the media has a unique identifier  (video.mediaId)
custom_expected: THEN the media ID should be tracked in Adobe Analytics (prop25)

title: Video Title Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is watching MLB.tv content
custom_steps: WHEN the content has a title (video.title)
custom_expected: THEN the title should be tracked in Adobe Analytics (prop30)

title: Unique Video/Stream Name Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is watching MLB.tv content
custom_steps: WHEN the content has a unique video/stream name (video.assetName)
custom_expected: THEN the unique name should be tracked in Adobe Analytics (evar190)

title: Feed Name Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is watching MLB.tv content
custom_steps: WHEN the content has a feed name (video.feedName)
custom_expected: THEN the feed name should be tracked in Adobe Analytics (evar192, evar61)

title: User Entitlements Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has entitlements for MLB.tv content
custom_steps: WHEN the user is consuming media
custom_expected: THEN the entitlements should be tracked in Adobe Analytics (evar20)

title: Audio Overlay Feed Name Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user selects an audio overlay in MLB.tv (video.audioOverlay.feedName)
custom_expected: THEN the selected audio overlay feed name should be tracked in Adobe Analytics (evar81)

title: Matchup Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is watching MLB.tv content
custom_steps: WHEN the content has a matchup (video.matchup)
custom_expected: THEN the matchup should be tracked in Adobe Analytics (prop40)

title: Game ID Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is watching MLB.tv content
custom_steps: WHEN the content has a game ID (gamePk)
custom_expected: THEN the game ID should be tracked in Adobe Analytics (evar171)

title: Autoplay Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is watching MLB.tv content
custom_steps: WHEN the content is being watched via autoplay (video.autoplay)
custom_expected: THEN the autoplay status should be tracked in Adobe Analytics (evar170)

title: Content Restrictions Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is interacting with MLB.tv content
custom_steps: WHEN the content has restrictions (video.contentRestrictions)
custom_expected: THEN the content restrictions should be tracked in Adobe Analytics (prop44)

title: Verify Asset Name
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is watching a video
custom_steps: WHEN the video starts playing
custom_expected:
THEN the unique video/stream name (assetName) should be passed to Conviva for tracking
AND any changes to the unique video/stream name during the streaming session should be accurately reflected in Conviva's data

title: Verify Stream URL
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a video stream
custom_steps: WHEN the video stream starts playing
custom_expected:
THEN the manifest URL of the video stream (Stream URL) should be passed to Conviva for tracking
AND the Stream URL should be consistent with the one provided in the tracking object
AND any changes to the Stream URL during the streaming session should be accurately reflected in Conviva's data

title: Verify Live or VOD Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a video stream
custom_steps: WHEN the video stream starts playing
custom_expected: THEN the Live or VOD Boolean value (1 for Live, 0 for VOD) should be passed to Conviva for tracking

title: Verify Content Length Tracking through Conviva
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a video stream
custom_steps: WHEN the video stream starts playing
custom_expected:
THEN the content length should be passed to Conviva for tracking
AND Conviva should record the content length in its analytics data

title: Verify App Name Tracking through Conviva
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a video stream
custom_steps: WHEN the video stream starts playing
custom_expected: THEN the App Name should be passed to Conviva for tracking

title: Verify Viewer ID Tracking through Conviva
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a video stream
custom_steps: WHEN the video stream starts playing
custom_expected: THEN the Viewer ID should be track to Conviva

title: Verify Device Model Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a video stream
custom_steps: WHEN the video stream starts playing
custom_expected: THEN the Device Model should be collected by the Conviva SDK

title: Verify Device Manufacturer Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a video stream
custom_steps: WHEN the video stream starts playing
custom_expected: THEN the Device Manufacturer should be collected by the Conviva SDK

title: Verify Device OS Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a video stream
custom_steps: WHEN the video stream starts playing
custom_expected: THEN the Device OS should be collected by the Conviva SDK

title: Verify Device OS Version Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a video stream
custom_steps: WHEN the video stream starts playing
custom_expected: THEN the Device OS Version should be collected by the Conviva SDK

title: Verify Device Type Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a video stream
custom_steps: WHEN the video stream starts playing
custom_expected: THEN the Device Type should be collected by the Conviva SDK

title: Verify Device Name Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a video stream
custom_steps: WHEN the video stream starts playing
custom_expected: THEN the Device Name should be collected by the Conviva SDK

title: Verify Device Marketing Name Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a video stream
custom_steps: WHEN the video stream starts playing
custom_expected: THEN the Device Marketing Name should be collected by the Conviva SDK

title: Verify Device OS Family Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a video stream
custom_steps: WHEN the video stream starts playing
custom_expected: THEN the Device OS Family should be collected by the Conviva SDK

title: Verify Browser Name Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a video stream
custom_steps: WHEN the video stream starts playing
custom_expected: THEN the Browser Name should be collected by the Conviva SDK

title: Verify Browser Version Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a video stream
custom_steps: WHEN the video stream starts playing
custom_expected: THEN the Browser Version should be collected by the Conviva SDK

title: Verify FGUID Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user initiates a streaming session
custom_steps: WHEN the streaming session starts
custom_expected:
THEN the FGUID should be assigned to the streaming session
AND the FGUID should be passed to Adobe for backend reporting
AND Adobe should link the records using the FGUID

title: Verify Location Name Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a streaming session
custom_steps: WHEN the streaming session starts
custom_expected:
THEN the Location Name should be collected to determine region/node
AND the Location Name should be recorded in Conviva's analytics data

title: Verify Media Type Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a streaming session
custom_steps: WHEN the streaming session starts
custom_expected:
THEN the Media Type (Audio or Video) should be tracked
AND the Media Type should be recorded in Conviva's analytics data

title: Verify Playback Scenario Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a streaming session
custom_steps: WHEN the streaming session starts
custom_expected:
THEN the Playback Scenario should be tracked
AND the Playback Scenario should be recorded in Conviva's analytics data

title: Verify Platform Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a streaming session
custom_steps: WHEN the streaming session starts
custom_expected:
THEN the Platform (MLB's name for the device) should be tracked
AND the Platform should be recorded in Conviva's analytics data

title: Verify Partner Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a streaming session
custom_steps: WHEN the streaming session starts
custom_expected:
THEN the Partner value should be tracked
AND the Partner value should be recorded in Conviva's analytics data

title: Verify Media State Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a streaming session
custom_steps: WHEN the streaming session starts
custom_expected:
THEN the Media State value should be tracked
AND the Media State value should be recorded in Conviva's analytics data

title: Verify User ID Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a streaming session
custom_steps: WHEN the streaming session starts
custom_expected:
THEN the User ID (Okta ID or deviceId/receiptId) should be tracked
AND the User ID should be recorded in Conviva's analytics data

title: Verify App Version Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a streaming session
custom_steps: WHEN the streaming session starts
custom_expected:
THEN the App Version should be tracked
AND the App Version should be recorded in Conviva's analytics data

title: Verify Product Type Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a streaming session
custom_steps: WHEN the streaming session starts
custom_expected: THEN the Product Type (game or non-game) should be tracked

title: Verify Content Type Tracking
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is accessing a streaming session
custom_steps: WHEN the streaming session starts
custom_expected:
THEN the Content Type should be tracked
AND the Content Type should be recorded in Conviva's analytics data
